player_decision.reason: Button with K6o in a 3-player game — no raisers. Small standard steal to apply pressure on the blinds and pick up the pot or see a cheap flop. Keeps investment small while pursuing chip accumulation.

We have ~5 BB in the SB with AQ offsuit facing a button min-raise. Shoving maximizes fold equity and value; calling leaves us with an awkward SPR and being out of position, and a small 3-bet commits us anyway.

With KK in a 3‑way preflop pot facing Alice’s all‑in for 45, calling 35 to match the bet gives you strong equity and a large pot to win. Folding is too weak with a premium hand; re‑raising is unnecessary here. You still have a healthy stack to play later streets.
Pot odds are favorable: calling the ~30 to contest a ~150 pot is +EV. K6s has reasonable equity three-way; don’t fold good odds but avoid overcommitting with an AllIn.

Weak hand (7h Js) on Kh 9c 8c with only backdoor straight potential (four tens as outs). A small bet of 10 into a 150-pot tests opponents' ranges, may take the pot down if they fold, and preserves your stack (~165) while you still have runner-runner outs. Betting small is safer than committing to a large raise or a shove with no real equity.

I have top pair (Kx) with a weak kicker on a dry K-9-8 board. Charlie’s bet is small (10) — good pot odds to see the turn without committing my short stack. Calling preserves fold equity and lets me evaluate the turn before risking more chips in the tournament.

Turn bet of 10 into 170 pot gives you backdoor straight draw (need a 10 on river) with 4 clean outs. Calling 10 has positive expected value (roughly +EV) given pot odds and potential showdown without committing too many chips.

Turn: Kh 9c 8c 9s. I hold Ks6c — that gives me two pair (Kings and Nines), a very strong hand on this board. My stack is short (25) and the pot is large (170), so shoving for value maximizes fold equity and will get called by worse (Kx, draws, weaker pairs). Although a held 9 by Charlie would beat me, I must accumulate chips to win the tournament — AllIn is the correct, high-expected-value play here.
Four outs (4/46 ≈ 8.7%) to a straight on the river with 7h Js on Kh 9c 8c 9s. Pot odds require about 35% to call; folding is the optimal play here to preserve tournament equity.
